intro: Tuckermania conradii, commonly known as the Conradi's tuckermania, is a rare and delicate flowering plant native to the high elevations of the western United States. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes carrots and parsley, and is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves. The plant produces small, white to pale yellow flowers arranged in umbels, typical of its family. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and requires cool, shaded environments to flourish. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, Tuckermania conradii is considered a vulnerable species.
